website_summaries.verdict: An inexpensive, unobtrusive way to add functionality to your laptop.
pros: This dock’s primary use is to add monitor support with DisplayPort or HDMI plugs, but it also offers two USB 3.0 ports for peripherals like mice, keyboards, webcams, and storage devices
A 1 gigabit Ethernet port is included as well
cons: The amount of additional ports is small compared to other products

customer_reviews.title: Able to get 4k@60hz with a 2017 Surface Pro
customer_reviews.text: With this "active" mini-DisplayPort to HDMI adapter I was able to get a rock solid 4k@60hz signal from my 2017 Surface Pro to my 28" Samsung UHD monitor. I tried two other "non-active" mini-DisplayPort to HDMI adapters that claimed 4k@60hz, none were able to sync higher than 30hz. Nice sleek design, not quite a slim as the non-active adapters, but slimmer than the other "active" ones within the same price point. Sturdy painted aluminum construction, good gauge neck. My only complaints might be not having gold plated connectors and the white on black branding. Would purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive solution
customer_reviews.text: This review has been updated. My first review unfairly blamed this part on an issue I was seeing. This device works great. It's super easy to use and it gets recognized on my MacBook Pro automatically, with no settings or configuration necessary. It could use another USB port or two, but that's a nit-picky issue.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Parker

customer_reviews.title: Supports Linux KDE neon
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice active adapter that worked at the intended resolution and refresh rate (3840x2160@60Hz) under both Windows 10 and KDE neon. When it initially did not work at 60hz in Linux, I'd questioned everything (cables, mini display port, TV, etc) and finally after wasting a lot of time with numerous permutations, found the problem was with the MS Surface dock not supporting Linux the same way it supports Windows 10. Even after latest dock firmware upgrades, it would not run at 60Hz in Linux. This adapter and a USB-ethernet adapter must be directly plugged into the side of the Surface Pro, for both to function correctly in Linux.
customer_reviews.author: The Greenman

customer_reviews.title: great idea but can be frustrating
customer_reviews.text: I loved the idea of a single device where I could plug in my Mac and my PC without moving plugs. I have found it very frustrating as it seems to 'go to sleep' after sitting idle for some time and when I restart my MAC or PC the network connection seems to disappear. Once I disconnect the USB cable and plug it back in everything wakes up. I was surprise when I go it that it required me to take up my Thunderbolt and USB port in order for it to work so read carefully if you only have one USB port (an older mac).
customer_reviews.author: JIm

customer_reviews.title: Look for a different solution
customer_reviews.text: Had potential, that faded quickly. Started out using on my Mbook Pro - Video using display port flickered on/off to the point it was unusable. Started the return process - low and behold I have a Surface with the ports required - not enough power to run an external hard drive, yet my anker 4 port USB hub ($11) works flawlessly. Move along and find something else... Not worth the time of $$$$
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Hayes

customer_reviews.title: Meets expectations!
customer_reviews.text: Product meets my expectation for functionality. Had to figure out a few things in order to get my laptop, second monitor, and HDMI cable to work. I have only owned the product for a week so I can’t review its durability. I am glad this product exists, that I found it on Amazon, that it works how I had hoped, and the order-to-delivery time was quick. As far as price, it seems something so simple should be slightly less expensive and that’s why I gave only 4 stars for ‘value for money.’ I am satisfied with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Picky Reader

customer_reviews.title: works great, very very lightweight
customer_reviews.text: very lightweight so it is great for backpack traveling. I just wish the cords were longer because I have the Surface with 2 ports near the top and put the laptop on a 4.5" box for better posture/head position. Finally, I ran the cords between the Surface screen and prop to the left side so much of it fits in that triangle and I can more easily move my laptop forward or backward on my desk.
customer_reviews.author: John Carr

customer_reviews.title: Not compatible period
customer_reviews.text: I have an iMac running 10.11. According to the specs it should to be compatible. Is it not. Also I followed the instructions on the enclosed small manual. I checked the System Report and it didn't show USB 10/100/100 blah, blah.... The report recognized every USB 3 device connected. Too good to be true..... Is going back ! Kinda pricey just to gain 2 USB ports. I'll do better using a USB 3 HUB, as I have been doing for years
customer_reviews.author: Wasee

customer_reviews.title: Perfect adapter at a great price.
customer_reviews.text: This is a perfect adapter at a good price. I use it on my Microsoft Surface Book when we travel. It's great to plug my laptop into TVs in hotels and cruise ships to watch movies and view the pictures of our trip. Sound works great via HDMI. I have used it in stereo, 5.1, and 7.2 surround sound mode when plugged into various devices. Never a problem. The only complaint is that the HDMI end is a little large, but I'll still give it five stars.
customer_reviews.author: Don Y

customer_reviews.title: Good Macbook Air Accessory
customer_reviews.text: The device works as expected and is priced right. I deducted one star because included documentation states that NIC port works out of box with MacOS. This is not the case with 10.14. I had to download a Realtek driver from the internet to get that working.
customer_reviews.author: Greg A. Dial

customer_reviews.title: Great for thunderbolt 2
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my 2017 MacBook Air and it is working great so I don’t need to unplug the monitor & printer everytime I move my laptop. I also like that it gave me a place for my network wire. My MacBook did not have the latest thunderbolt connector (I have 2 and not 3) and this was one of the few reasonably priced docks still available. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: HV

customer_reviews.title: Not a Thunderbolt Hub
customer_reviews.text: This may work well with video, but I was hoping it would serve as a Thunderbolt 2 hub. But the DisplayPort input apparently does not support Thunderbolt 2 as does the Mac port. Consequently, the USB function and the video function seem to be separate. Also, it should come with a power supply.
customer_reviews.author: P. Buck

customer_reviews.title: Cords are a little hard but they work properly. ...
customer_reviews.text: Cords are a little hard but they work properly. All connections work as they should, just wish it had more USB ports. If the cords were longer and had at least one more USB port, I'd give it a 5 star. Having only 2 USB ports makes it to where you only get one extra USB port. Not much of a gain.
customer_reviews.author: Hugo381

customer_reviews.title: Product is crap overall. Signal goes out and doesn't work after computer goes into screen saver
customer_reviews.text: Started off ok. Then it starts having problem. I leave my computer on and the monitors on when I'm stepping away. When I come back to wake up the computer, I start getting 'No Signal'. This is just irritating. Now I'm sitting here with only one of my monitor working (the one that is connected to my macbook pro via HDMI), and the other monitor connected through this adapter not working because it says No Signal. Frustrating. I have to restart my computer every time now. I would NOT RECOMMEND this product. Buy this if you want No Signal popping up and you want some headache
customer_reviews.author: Fun2badult

customer_reviews.title: Only HDMI works
customer_reviews.text: I bought this 2 years ago, and only managed to make the HDMI work on my MacBook Air. USB and Ethernet ports won't work. Yesterday I noticed there was a DC IN port on the unit, but didn't specify the voltage. Searching on the seller's website, i saw a picture saying in small "DC 5V (optional) not required and Power Adapter not included. Hence the one-star rating as it is a rather large box to provide just an HDMI conversion from a mini-display port. Doesn't perform as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Max

customer_reviews.title: Works seamlessly with 1080p and Ultrawide monitors
customer_reviews.text: I'm using this to connect an older MacBook Air with a Lightning 2 port to an LG Ultrawide (2160 x 1080) monitor. It worked perfectly right out of the box and the image on the wide screen is amazing. Being able to use a large monitor on the MacBook Air makes all the difference in the world.
customer_reviews.author: TexasVeteran62

customer_reviews.title: It works great and transmits both the video and the game's audio
customer_reviews.text: I carry this in my Surface Pro 4 bag. I haven't run into any problems with any TV that I have hooked up to. Sometimes I plug the Surface into the HDMI Aux on the front of my home theater receiver and play games on the big screen. It works great and transmits both the video and the game's audio.
customer_reviews.author: A. Hilton

customer_reviews.title: Not what I was wanting
customer_reviews.text: I have a MacMini with full USB Ports and two Thunderbolt 2 ports (currently unused) I was hoping to use this to access the USB port on the hub through the Thunderbolt 2 port. At this time, I am not planning on using a second monitor. So this was too expensive for a net gain of 1 USB port. Returned.
customer_reviews.author: Vik-Thor

customer_reviews.title: This was all I needed
customer_reviews.text: After purchasing four different docking stations trying to find the right one, turns out this was the only thing I needed. Took 1 minute to install and works perfectly on my MacBook Pro dual monitor setup. I already had the HDMI cords and this was the final missing piece. So happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Ethernet requires driver installation on MacOS; product DOES work on my Mid-2015 Retina Macbook Pro
customer_reviews.text: Bought to use as a dock. Works fine with my USB keyboard and mouse and HDMI-equipped monitor. Ethernet port required download and installation of the driver from the vendor's website - I expected it to work out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Koberg

customer_reviews.title: Having a problem and need an answer
customer_reviews.text: Since I can find no one to ask this question to. No tech support for this projector at all. I'll ask it here and see if I get some direction. When playing a bunch of pictures some of them are displayed sideways or upside down but viewing them on my computer they look fine. Any thoughts about why this happens and what I can do about it?
customer_reviews.author: John Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Good device, Does its job.
customer_reviews.text: It's a good quality device, does what it's supposed to do, does its job, plus its USB ports are strong enough to power other USB devices (without additional power). It's able to power monitor through its hdmi while my other available hdmi powers my other monitor, giving me the option of an extended or mirrored desktop.
customer_reviews.author: TRAVIS T PECK

customer_reviews.title: Does not work as "active" converter UHD 4K (3840x2160 @30Hz)
customer_reviews.text: I received a refund for this product. Because the very good customer service, I update this product to 4 stars. Original Review: I received this gofanco converter that has noise on the top of the screen when it is working as "Active" converter UHD 4K (3840x2160 @30Hz). When I use my other DP to HDMI converter "Moshi" () With the same computer, cable Hdmi 2.0, display and "Active" converter UHD 4K (3840x2160 @30Hz), the Moshi converter works good.
customer_reviews.author: X-Nerd

customer_reviews.title: work good
customer_reviews.text: I was able to use this to add a third monitor to my surface pro 3 ( main, original docking station hdmi and this)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Ethernet didn't work
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted this to work, but the Ethernet didn't get a connection despite blinking lights. Anyone have another suggestion for a MAC with Thunderbolt 2, please let me know!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product at a fraction of the cost
customer_reviews.text: I've been looking for a dock for my 2014 Macbook Air for a while but just couldn't justify over $200. This has everything I need and works perfectly. I've been using it for about two weeks now and I couldn't be happier.
customer_reviews.author: TJ

customer_reviews.title: solves your problem when using a multi monitor display card
customer_reviews.text: Thanks, perfectly fixed my problem, could not connect with new card, did not understand passive/non passive at time, but realized I needed these to go beyond x number of monitors. Great product
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for MacBook Air 2017
customer_reviews.text: The only issue I had was that ethernet did not work right out of the box, but a simple driver download from the vendor site solved that. Nice little unit.
customer_reviews.author: William B. Trent

customer_reviews.title: This product works great with my 2015 MACBook air
customer_reviews.text: This product works great. I needed it to bring a wired connection and an HDMI connection to a monitor into a room away from my router. I was a bit nervous because the direction claimed I needed to upgrade my MAC OS which could be a can of worms in the older MACBook Air I have. So before I went down the path, I simply plugged it in. Absolutely plug and play and works like a charm.
customer_reviews.author: Cynde Denson

customer_reviews.title: NOT PLUG AN PLAY
customer_reviews.text: This unit requires you to set up an account and download an app an other garbage. No thanks, work or do not work. Am am not cool with microsoft protocol that forces you to join a club or give up your information for something as simple as a light switch.
customer_reviews.author: lollipop

customer_reviews.title: Great Bargain!
customer_reviews.text: Compared to other adapters for Thunderbolt 2 ports, this item is a bargain. It is hard to find adaptors to convert thunderbolt 2 ports to USB at any price, but this one not only does that but offers other options as well.
customer_reviews.author: Atawahinta

customer_reviews.title: Nice product as described.
customer_reviews.text: Nice product as described and was exactly what I needed to extend my laptop to another monitor during the COVID-19 work remote situation.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Causes my Mac to disconnects from WiFi
customer_reviews.text: The adapter is of low quality, and it causes my MacBook Pro to disconnects from wifi when used to connect an external monitor.
customer_reviews.author: RHH

customer_reviews.title: Works for surface pro 5 out to 4k60hz with no input lag
customer_reviews.text: Works for my microsoft surface pro 5 to 4k TV at 60hz. Just what I need. No noticable input lag.
customer_reviews.author: Julian L.

customer_reviews.title: best fix to having an old Mac and needing a dock for a 2nd monitor
customer_reviews.text: All the other Thunderbolt 2 docks are in the hundreds of dollars and that stinks. This is great.
customer_reviews.author: AJ Hunter

customer_reviews.title: Does the trick when others Failed!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to hook up multiple monitor setups for my laptop. Works PERFECTLY! Many others wouldn't give me a proper signal but this ACTIVE displayport seems to do the trick!
customer_reviews.author: RealityCheckVR

customer_reviews.title: This is a pass-through ethernet plug, not a port
customer_reviews.text: I thought I could use this in an office with a network. The monitor plug works fine, but the ethernet is useless to me. If you need a connector that has an address, don't buy it. I have been waiting for their customer support and amazon's customer support to help me, but thus far I have not been able to return it either. Total rip-off, as far as I'm concerned.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara F Ives

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't feed video to TV
customer_reviews.text: Don't know what's up with this cable. Doesn't feed video from Surface Pro 4 to TV. I've look all into the settings and nothing works. Even spoke with Microsoft and troubleshot the problems and they said it must be the cable. Now it's in a pile for a garage sale waiting on the next sucker to think it's a good deal.
customer_reviews.author: Rafael G.

customer_reviews.title: Solved my monitor support issue!
customer_reviews.text: I had purchased an Ultra-Wide monitor, resolution 2560x1080, which I thought my iMac would not support. After researching, I realized that my mini DisplayPort (Thunderbolt) to HDMI adapter was an older generation spec. The only other thing I'd suggest instead, if for a Thunderbolt port, is a break out box by CalDigit, OWC or Elgato, which will give you additional ports as well! (This actually made my purchase of the adapter unnecessary a week later...)
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Low cost expansion of my MacBook Air (13" early 2015)
customer_reviews.text: Works great with macOS Catalina 10.15.1 and my older MacBook Air (13 inch, Early 2015). This adds new convenience to my old laptop. I have no experience with reliability now, but looks well made. Couldn't be happier.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Finman

customer_reviews.title: Poor display quality
customer_reviews.text: The image managed to display properly but unfortunately the quality was poor. The image was distorted and appeared to "buzz" or wave randomly. It's slight but it's definitely noticeable and quite distracting. This was a step up from most other adapters I tried that would simply cut out or not display at all but still quite disappointing since it was recommended as compatible with the Surface Book docking station from Microsoft's tech support site.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The replacement working great
customer_reviews.text: The unit I received was unusable due to flickering on the external monitors. The same issue with different set ups, including Surface Pro 3, Macbook Pro and Air with different monitors. The customer service was great and promptly arranged for a replacement unit. The second unit I received works fine so far. It looks the same except that the second unit says v3.0 (top one in the picture), so looks like it's an updated unit.
customer_reviews.author: ms88

customer_reviews.title: Great graphics, easy setup.
customer_reviews.text: I have had no issues thus far in using this hardware to allow me a third monitor with my PC. The graphics quality is great!
customer_reviews.author: Duncan Gardner

customer_reviews.title: Does exactly what you want it to.
customer_reviews.text: Bought it to make an asus 980 laptop g751jy work with HTC vive. Make sure it's the active one. Work great. Get almost the same performance as my PC with 1080ti.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: This thing just works.
customer_reviews.text: Didn't have a single issue installing or using it for the past two years.
customer_reviews.author: Omri

customer_reviews.title: Works for me!
customer_reviews.text: Just what I needed to get the higher resolution on my Surface Pro 4 and my Samsung 49" 4K curved TV/Monitor. Also works like a champ on the 65" Samsung 4K flat in the conference room.
customer_reviews.author: Charles

customer_reviews.title: USB port draws too much power
customer_reviews.text: After about 3 months my computer complains that I can't plug the dock into its USB port because the dock is drawing too much power. Maybe if I had bought the external power supply for the dock I wouldn't be having this issue.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Works as Advertised
customer_reviews.text: No big deal, just does as advertised. It works. MiniPort out to HDMI.
customer_reviews.author: Steven D. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Works for Surface Book Windows 10 Pro
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my Surface Book to play on HDMI capable devices that don't have screen mirroring capabilities. It works great on my older Samsung 60 TV. Works as advertised, no problems. I keep in my laptop bag with my Surface Book. I see myself using this in my hotel rooms when I travel for work.
customer_reviews.author: M'anne

customer_reviews.title: Works great with my 4K monitor
customer_reviews.text: Very good results with my Surface Pro 5 to LG 4K monitor.
customer_reviews.author: hernan

customer_reviews.title: Broken
customer_reviews.text: External screen turned off whenever the adapter was touched. Tested my cables and ports, and all worked fine. I could reproduce the problem by tapping the large plastic part while holding the port connections firm. I've returned it.
customer_reviews.author: Gggirlgeek

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: On time and as advertised. Works where others did not.
customer_reviews.author: J-Darb

customer_reviews.title: Not what I am looking for
customer_reviews.text: The item did not fulfill the expectations, after following the instructions. I have two additional monitors for which I needed the item. I was only able to connect to one of the monitors, not the two.
customer_reviews.author: luis

customer_reviews.title: no-fuss, flawless video and audio (1080p)
customer_reviews.text: Worked perfectly out of the box at 1080p, mirroring a ThinkPad L540 to a Samsung 3D TV. I don't have a 4k display so I haven't tested higher resolutions. The connections are solid. There doesn't seem to be any difference in video and audio quality from a native HDMI source.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: The Active version of this product allowed me to connect ...
customer_reviews.text: The Active version of this product allowed me to connect my Mac Mini to an LG UltraWide display using the native panel resolution.
customer_reviews.author: Jorge

customer_reviews.title: Installation was quick and easy with adaptor
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly. Used to attach LG Monitor to MS docking station for Surface Pro. Installation was quick and easy with adaptor. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Davis

customer_reviews.title: Works Nicely
customer_reviews.text: My Surface Pro has very few ports and this allows to to connect the tablet to various cables. Small footprint and seems well constructed. Time will tell on how durable it is. I only received this just a week or so ago.
customer_reviews.author: Men With Three Legs

customer_reviews.title: Bought the Gofanco Mini Display Port to HDMI Adapter for ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought the Gofanco Mini Display Port to HDMI Adapter for my Microsoft Surface Book Computer. The Adapter is very well made and works perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Kuckelman

customer_reviews.title: Save your money!
customer_reviews.text: Save your money. If you need a dock, save up and buy the Microsoft Surface dock. All this gets you for $50 is another usb-a port and hard-wired ethernet port. I wish I had saved the package so I could return it.
customer_reviews.author: Garrett Haertel

customer_reviews.title: I highly recommend this adapter
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a solution to connect a Seiki 39" 4k TV/Monitor to my Dell XPS 13. The XPS 13 has a MiniDisplay Port connector so I purchased a adaptor cable to connect to the HDMI connector on the TV. However when I tried to select 3840 x 2140 the selection was not available on my XPS 13. When I connected this gofanco adapter 3840 x 2140 appeared in the list of resolutions and it worked perfectly. I highly recommend this adapter.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy

customer_reviews.title: it is relatively short and could be easy to lose so make sure you have a closed ...
customer_reviews.text: It works perfectly and I have had no issues with it yet. I have tried playing video and the audio worked perfectly. 5 stars because the product has given me no trouble. Word of advice, it is relatively short and could be easy to lose so make sure you have a closed bag to put it in.
customer_reviews.author: Joella

customer_reviews.title: Portability and convenient
customer_reviews.text: Liked that’s its light weight and portable. A little pricey and the cable a little long or stiff that the unit is hard to settle in a convenient position.
customer_reviews.author: Ben DeLeon

customer_reviews.title: Works with my 2015 Macbook Air
customer_reviews.text: Had a hard time finding the right docking station to support my 2015 Macbook Air but this one works great. Only drawback is that it only supports one monitor, not two.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Worked with my card since the factory one didn't come with Active ports.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Reeves

customer_reviews.title: HIGHLY RECOMMENDED
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly on my Microsoft Surface 3. Solved the problem I was having with Surface 3 crashing when I connect mini displayport/HDMI cable.
customer_reviews.author: Keith C.

customer_reviews.title: The v1. 0 version worked flawlessly no matter the ...
customer_reviews.text: The v1.0 version worked flawlessly no matter the combination of monitors/TVs/Projectors, all on a Mac Pro 2013 model. The v3.0 did not have the same result.
customer_reviews.author: ruphus

customer_reviews.title: Good device, you will need to understand how to ...
customer_reviews.text: Good device, you will need to understand how to set up the LAN connection though. It does power everything and it’s very light and plug and play!
customer_reviews.author: Marcos D.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: does exactly what I needed it to do, that is connect my apple laptop to my vizio tv.
customer_reviews.author: Adventure and Coffee

customer_reviews.title: This saved the day when the one my husbands work ...
customer_reviews.text: This saved the day when the one my husbands work provided stopped working. He's using it to connect a Mac with a monitor on daily basis.
customer_reviews.author: NTreesh

customer_reviews.title: Great deal on a great accessory
customer_reviews.text: This worked without a hitch. I love seeing my MacBook on my 4K screen.
customer_reviews.author: tSkewl

customer_reviews.title: Worked great running a 4K monitor
customer_reviews.text: Worked great running a 4K monitor. I am using a Macbook Pro to drive a Thunderbolt display and a Acer 28 inch. this adapter worked great to connect the Acer monitor.
customer_reviews.author: Sudipto

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't recognize my USB devices on MacBook Pro 2015.
customer_reviews.text: Title says it all. Completely nonfunctional based on the product description.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: So far so good!!
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. I would give it 5-stars but I have only used it once and it worked as expected on a Lenovo T440

customer_reviews.text: It's makes it seem like i could use it for something i couldn't.

customer_reviews.text: ALL WORKED BUT HDMI HAD NO SOUND ON HIGH SIERRA
customer_reviews.author: jpa813

customer_reviews.title: It works well
customer_reviews.text: I love this splitter. Very happy with it. Hard to find this kind of equipment nowadays.

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly for connecting my Surface Pro 3 to my ...
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly for connecting my Surface Pro 3 to my 55" Vizio TV using this adapter & an HDMI cable. No problems, will update if it gives out on me.
customer_reviews.author: R. Kom

customer_reviews.title: After some configuration in part of the surface book the adapter worked good. It's been on for about a week now
customer_reviews.text: Delivered on time. Worked as advertise. I ordered two for my surface book dock. After some configuration in part of the surface book the adapter worked good. It's been on for about a week now.
customer_reviews.author: Kazi Pappu

customer_reviews.title: I had troubles getting a 4k to work with a ...
customer_reviews.text: I had troubles getting a 4k to work with a Seiki SE39UY04 from a Lenovo w550s and a MacBook Pro. Once I plugged this in both the Mac and Lenovo immediately picked up the 4k resolution.
customer_reviews.author: Alan Blythe

customer_reviews.title: needed for 4K resolution from a Surface Pro 3
customer_reviews.text: needed an active adapter to generate the 4K resolution from a Surface Pro 3 computer. this adapter delivers

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Using these to connect husband's new LG 4K TV to his computer's AMD video card. Works GREAT!

customer_reviews.title: This device works well to adapt an HDMI display to ...
customer_reviews.text: This device works well to adapt an HDMI display to a Microsoft Surface Book, but does not work when using a Microsoft Surface Dock (docking station) connected to the Surface Book to the display. The display continually flickers when using the Surface Dock.
customer_reviews.author: KURT E RADECKI

customer_reviews.title: All great, hdmi port doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: Which is a bummer because I bought this docker mainly for display extension.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised. Drives a 4K display @ 30Hz without issues. Will NOT do 60hz.
customer_reviews.author: Tessa

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works exactly as described and as it should. All ports are functional, the adapter was tested with MBAir.
customer_reviews.author: Dorottya Pálics

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality and Low price!
customer_reviews.text: The device is work, the promised functionality and quality is correct!
customer_reviews.author: Puskás Attila Barna

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works fine on my macbook to connect on TV. HDMI sound etc works great.
customer_reviews.author: MSS

customer_reviews.title: One happy user
customer_reviews.text: Great product and great value for money, would definitely recommend.

customer_reviews.title: Works great!

product_meta.title: gofanco Gold Plated Mini DisplayPort to HDMI 4K Display Adapter (Black) - Thunderbolt 2 Compatible for MacBooks & Mac Mini, Surface Pro's, Surface Book, Chromebook Pixel, etc. (mDPHDMI4K2K)
product_meta.description:
Style:4Kx2K Adapter

 gofanco Mini DisplayPort to HDMI 4K Adapter connects Mini DisplayPort compatible devices such as Apple MacBooks, and Microsoft Surface tablets, Ultrabooks and laptops with a Mini DisplayPort output to HDMI equipped monitors, displays and HDTVs. It supports displays of up to 4Kx2K HDTV and is ideal for business, home entertainment, conference rooms, and more 

 Connectors 
- Input: 20-pin Mini DisplayPort / Thunderbolt Port Male 
- Output: 19-pin HDMI Female (Note: A separate HDMI cable, not included, is required) 

 Specifications 
- PC resolution supported: 800x600, 1024x768, 1280x768, 1280x800, 1280x960, 1280x1024, 1440x900, 1600x1200, 1680x1050, 1920x1080, 2560x1080@60Hz, 1920x1200, 2048x1536, 2560x1440@60Hz, 3840x2160@30Hz, 4096x2160@24Hz 
- HDTV resolution supported: 480i, 576i, 480p, 576p, 1080i and 1080p@60Hz, 4Kx2K @30Hz 
- Audio: 7.1 Channel surround audio 
- Bandwidth: Up to 3.0 Gbps 
- Length: 9.25” (23.5cm) 
- Regulatory approvals: FCC, CE, RoHS 

 Compatible Devices (Current Known Devices) 
- Apple MacBook, MacBook Pro, MacBook Air, iMac, Mac mini, Mac Pro 
- Microsoft Surface Pro/Pro 2/Pro 3/Pro 4, Surface 3, Surface Book (NOT Surface/Surface 2) 
- Lenovo ThinkPad X1 Carbon, X230/240s, L430/440, L530/540, T430/440, T440s, T440p, T530/540p, W530/540, Helix 
- Dell XPS 13/14/15/17, Latitude E7240/E7440, Precision M3800 
- Alienware 14/17/18 
- Acer Aspire R7 
- Intel NUC 
- Asus Zenbook UX303LA/UX303LN 
- HP Envy 14/17 
- Google Chromebook Pixel 
- Cyberpower Zeusbook Edge X6-100/X6-200 
- Toshiba Satellite Pro S500, Tecra M11/A11/S11 
- Other major branded laptops 
Note: Not compatible with Thunderbolt 3 (USB-C) ports 

 Warranty & Support 
- Limited One-Year Warranty and Lifetime Product Support
feature_bullets: ✔ HIGH PERFORMANCE ADAPTER - Connects Mini DisplayPort / Thunderbolt enabled devices (Macbook Pro / Air, Surface Pro / Pro 2 / Pro 3 / Pro 4, Surface 3 & Surface Book, Google Chrome Pixel, Lenovo Thinkpads, Dell, HP and other major branded laptops) to HDMI displays
✔ HIGH QUALITY VIDEO - Supports HDTV resolutions of 4K (3840x2160) @30Hz, 4096x2160 @24Hz, 2560x1440 @60Hz, delivering crystal clear images to your digital life
✔ HIGH QUALITY AUDIO - Supports 7.1 Channel surround audio providing amazing surround sound quality for better entertainment experiences
✔ RELIABLE CONNECTION - Features Quad-shielded cable with PVC jacket for maximum video performance & prevention of signal loss as well as HDCP (High-bandwidth Digital Content Protection) support

✔ LOW-PROFILE PLUG & PLAY CONNECTOR - Leaves sufficient room for adjacent ports on your devices, no driver or software installation required! FCC, CE & RoHS compliant. We love our products and hope you will too. Our products are backed with a ONE YEAR limited warranty and experienced tech support team in Silicon Valley. If you have any questions or concerns regarding this product, please do not hesitate to contact us.
